title: Pedro de Valdivia Bridge
text:
Pedro de Valdivia Bridge is an <a href="arch%20bridge">arch</a> <a href="bridge">bridge</a> spanning <a href="Valdivia%20River">Valdivia River</a>, that separates downtown <a href="Valdivia%2C%20Chile">Valdivia</a> from <a href="Isla%20Teja">Isla Teja</a> island a residential area.
Together with <a href="R%C3%ADo%20Cruces%20Bridge">Río Cruces Bridge</a> (built in 1987) it allows connection from Valdivia to the coastal town <a href="Niebla%2C%20Chile">Niebla</a>. 
Pedro de Valdivia Bridge is named in honour of the founder of Valdivia the Spanish conquistador <a href="Pedro%20de%20Valdivia">Pedro de Valdivia</a>. It was opened in 1954 and survived the <a href="Great%20Chilean%20earthquake">Great Chilean earthquake</a>, the greatest earthquake ever recorded, while nearby buildings collapsed. After the earthquake it survived the effects of the <a href="Ri%C3%B1ihuazo">Riñihuazo</a>, a flooding caused by the earthquake.
